description: A compliance officer requests an export‑control training module based on EAR § 734.7. The assistant fetches the regulation text, extracts licensing concepts, creates a flow‑chart asset, generates a medium‑difficulty quiz, renders an interactive SCORM module, stores it in the LMS, and returns the published URL and record ID.

messages.content: You are CompliLearn Builder, an AI assistant that creates compliance training modules from regulatory texts, enriches them with multimedia, quizzes, and publishes them to the corporate LMS.

We need an export‑control training module for our engineering team, based on EAR § 734.7. Please include licensing requirements, a flow‑chart illustration, a medium‑difficulty quiz, and publish it to our LMS.
Understood. I’ll first retrieve the full text of EAR § 734.7.

{"text":"
Section 734.7 – License Requirements. 
(1) A license is required for the export, reexport, or transfer (in the U.S.) of items listed on the Commerce Control List (CCL) that are designated as EAR99, unless a license exception applies. 
(2) Encryption items, software, and technology that are controlled under Category 5, Part 2 of the CCL require a specific license. 
(3) The export of dual‑use items to embargoed destinations is prohibited without a license. 
(4) Deemed export of controlled technology to foreign nationals in the U.S. also requires a license. 
(5) Violations may result in civil penalties up to $300,000 per violation and criminal penalties up to $1,000,000 and imprisonment."}
Got the regulation text. I’ll now extract the key licensing concepts and obligations.

arguments.text:
Section 734.7 – License Requirements. 
(1) A license is required for the export, reexport, or transfer (in the U.S.) of items listed on the Commerce Control List (CCL) that are designated as EAR99, unless a license exception applies. 
(2) Encryption items, software, and technology that are controlled under Category 5, Part 2 of the CCL require a specific license. 
(3) The export of dual‑use items to embargoed destinations is prohibited without a license. 
(4) Deemed export of controlled technology to foreign nationals in the U.S. also requires a license. 
(5) Violations may result in civil penalties up to $300,000 per violation and criminal penalties up to $1,000,000 and imprisonment.

messages.content: {"concepts":[{"concept":"License Required","description":"A license is needed for export/reexport of EAR99 items unless an exception applies."},{"concept":"Encryption Items","description":"Encryption software and technology under Category 5 Part 2 require a specific license."},{"concept":"Dual‑Use to Embargoed Destinations","description":"Export of dual‑use items to embargoed countries is prohibited without a license."},{"concept":"Deemed Export","description":"Transfer of controlled technology to foreign nationals within the U.S. requires a license."}]}
I’ll generate a 5‑question medium‑difficulty quiz based on those concepts.

concepts.description: A license is needed for export/reexport of EAR99 items unless an exception applies.
Encryption software and technology under Category 5 Part 2 require a specific license.
Export of dual‑use items to embargoed countries is prohibited without a license.
Transfer of controlled technology to foreign nationals within the U.S. requires a license.

messages.content: {"quiz_id":"quiz_9f2c3d","questions":[{"question":"Which EAR classification generally requires a license unless an exception applies?","options":["EAR99","Category 1","Category 5 Part 2","Unrestricted"],"answer":"EAR99"},{"question":"Encryption items fall under which category of the CCL?","options":["Category 3","Category 5 Part 2","Category 9","Category 7"],"answer":"Category 5 Part 2"},{"question":"Exporting dual‑use items to an embargoed destination without a license results in which of the following?","options":["No penalty","Civil fine only","Criminal prosecution","Both civil and criminal penalties"],"answer":"Both civil and criminal penalties"},{"question":"A
I’m sorry, it looks like the quiz generation response was truncated. Let me regenerate the quiz correctly.
